input: Anne is blue. Anne is furry. Anne is kind. Anne is nice. Anne is red. Bob is furry. Bob is kind. Bob is nice. Bob is red. Erin is white. Gary is kind. All white, furry things are red. Kind, nice things are big. Big, nice things are furry. All kind things are white. If Gary is blue and Gary is white then Gary is red. All nice, kind things are white. If something is white then it is nice. If Bob is white then Bob is nice. If something is furry and blue then it is red. Question: Gary is red.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Bob : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Blue Anne
axiom T2 : Furry Anne
axiom T3 : Kind Anne
axiom T4 : Nice Anne
axiom T5 : Red Anne
axiom T6 : Furry Bob
axiom T7 : Kind Bob
axiom T8 : Nice Bob
axiom T9 : Red Bob
axiom T10 : White Erin
axiom T11 : Kind Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Furry x → Red x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Nice x → Big x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Big x ∧ Nice x → Furry x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → White x
axiom R5 : Blue Gary ∧ White Gary → Red Gary
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Kind x → White x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Nice x
axiom R8 : White Bob → Nice Bob
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ Blue x → Red x

theorem gary_is_red : Red Gary :=
begin
  apply R5,
  split,
  apply R9 Gary,
  split,
  apply R3 Gary,
  split,
  apply R2 Gary,
  split,
  exact T11,
  apply R7,
  apply R4,
  exact T11,
  apply R4,
  exact T11,
  apply R4,
  exact T11,
end

-- The answer is True
